version_description: This version includes minor layout fixes.

What's new:
• A survey where you can provide us your feedback on how we can improve NYT Cooking.
• Bug fixes and stability improvements.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this release we fixed some bugs.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this version, you’ll be able to opt in to get notified about new features and helpful tips. We’ll only notify you about things you haven’t yet discovered on your own. Get the most out of NYT Cooking!

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this release, we updated our app to support iOS 12. You must be running iOS 11 or higher to receive further updates.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this release we added Siri Shortcut support to the app. You can now set up Siri to open the recipe of the day, search, your recipe box, or your weekly plan.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

We added a new feature for login, making it easier to sign in to the app if you are logged in with your NYTimes account on the web. This version also includes some bug fixes on the home screen.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this release we fixed an issue that prevented users from submitting private notes to recipes.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy holidays!

This release includes bug fixes and accessibility improvements.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this release:

- We added personalized recipe recommendations to the home screen. These recommendations will improve as you save more recipes.
- See your recently viewed recipes on the home screen.
- Add whole collections of recipes to your Recipe Box.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this release: 

• You can now swipe to delete folders in the Recipe Box.
• We also added some usability improvements and bug fixes.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

Bug fixes and improvements.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this version, we've introduced Cook Mode, an exciting new feature that's all about helping you cook from our app.
You can now access Cook Mode from the 'Start Cooking' button in any recipe.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

You can now share recipes saved in your own folders. Just look for the share button in Saved Recipes.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this release, we improved swiping between ingredients and preparation steps in Cook Mode.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this release, we are adding the ability for you to receive notifications and learn about new recipes, seasonal favorites, etc. 

To make sure you can receive the notifications, in our app's menu, tap Settings > Notifications, then tap "Open Device Settings" and turn on "Allow Notifications". 

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this version we have fixed a potential crash and a minor issue with the login screen.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Happy cooking!

In this release we’ve enhanced the capability to link users from the web directly to recipes and other content in the app. We also fixed a bug related to keyword search.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Experience the new Dark Mode with this latest release.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Introducing the new Grocery List! Just go to any recipe, scroll down to ingredients and add them to your grocery list.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

In this release we've made improvements to the new Dark Mode and Grocery List features.

Starting this week, links in our newsletters to recipes, collections, guides, and other content now open directly in the NYT Cooking app.

We’ve also made some small improvements to our Start Cooking feature and fixed Dark Mode in our Recipe of the Day widget.

If you like our app, please take a moment to rate us in the App Store. For bug reports or suggestions, you can reach us at cookingcare@nytimes.com.

Bug fixes and improvements. Happy Holidays!

Experience a new way to multitask on the iPad. Users can now easily multitask with additional Cooking windows while cooking or organizing recipes and share Cooking links in other apps just by dragging a recipe.
